'

Only show the custom certificate popup when using EteSync interactively With this change we make it so using a self-signed certificate will have to be authorised on the first login rather than checked every time on the background. This was causing annoying issues with networks that mitm SSL connections and anyhow we shouldnt be asking users to trust bad certs when in 99.9% of the cases it would either be an attack or a broken network. Fixes #36

commit_message:
'

Show the login activity if the NotesActivity resumes and we no longer have a valid user. If the user cancels the login activity and are still unauthorized finish the NotesActivity because they must sign in to continue.\n

Open Commit'

'

Add Hockey api key\n

Open Commit'

'

Fix race condition where external app is reading artwork while an art source is writing new artwork In cases where an art source quickly writes two artwork back to back an external app listening for artwork changes may start reading the first artwork while the second artwork is being loaded (i.e. the row is inserted but the artwork has not been cached). By looking through all past artwork we ensure read operations always get a cached artwork if one exists.

Open Commit'

'

Dont stop service if overlay permission is denied Overlay permission is also denied if a permission dialog is open. So we dont want to kill the service because then we cant resume filtering when the permission dialog is closed. This is a bit hack-y right now because the service will be started indefinitely if the user actually has not granted overlay permission but thats a much less user-facing bug so we can put it off for now.

commit_message:
'

transport-xmpp: Catch IllegalStateExceptions Because of the race condition between isConnected() (or isAuthenticated()) and send() it happens sometimes that the connection goes down shortly after the isAuthenticated() check. In this case send() will throw an IllegalStateException: 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): FATAL EXCEPTION: MAXSTransportService[XMPP] 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): java.lang.IllegalStateException: Not connected to server. 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): at org.jivesoftware.smack.XMPPConnection.sendPacket(XMPPConnection.java:502) 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): at org.jivesoftware.smackx.MultipleRecipientManager.sendToIndividualRecipients(MultipleRecipientManager.java:210) 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): at org.jivesoftware.smackx.MultipleRecipientManager.send(MultipleRecipientManager.java:115) 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): at org.jivesoftware.smackx.MultipleRecipientManager.send(MultipleRecipientManager.java:72) 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): at org.projectmaxs.transport.xmpp.xmppservice.XMPPService.sendAsMessage(XMPPService.java:233) 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): at org.projectmaxs.transport.xmpp.xmppservice.XMPPService.send(XMPPService.java:173) 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): at org.projectmaxs.transport.xmpp.TransportService.onHandleIntent(TransportService.java:134) 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): at org.projectmaxs.shared.transport.MAXSTransportService$ServiceHandler.handleMessage(MAXSTransportService.java:40) 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) 10-02 14:44:44.394 E/AndroidRuntime(22293): at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:60)

commit_message:
'

Add a lock when pushing changes. This is not needed for proper deployments where the server properly locks the database tables. But in some older etesync server versions and possibly bad databases this is not the case. OpenTasks causes EteSync to concurrently try to sync so this at least makes sure this race condition doesnt happen for these rare cases.

Make Schedule class Serializable. It seems worth exploring though performance numbers look more impressive on the emulator than on my actual Pixel 1. Serialising Java objects is frowned upon for security reasons but this is just in local cache storage. I had some testing code for this in ScheduleUI but will work that out properly later.

vulnerability_tag: 'cwe-640: weak password recovery mechanism for forgotten password'

commit_message:
'

Fix collection editing following an encryption password change. A lot of the code dealing with collections assumes that the editing is done by the owner (true assumption for now) and therefore the encryption key is derived from the master key (not true anymore as it could be a stored version of the old key). This commit removes this wrong assumption.

Open Commit'
vulnerability_tag: 'cwe-324: use of a key past its expiration date'

Fix: Tapping on seekBar would be ignored (#760) -Change the progress by dragging the finger was working. However tapping on the progress bar to change the progress was not. I merged the progress in 1..4 condition with the checking seekBar.isPressed so it will be ignored when user is not pressing it. Also in the animationView.addAnimatorUpdateListener I changed the .toInt() into a .roundToInt() because toInt() was always giving the current_number -= -1 creating a race condition that would set the seekBar to 0. I tested my solution on a lot of the Showcase examples and Im confident there is no regression.

Open Commit'
vulnerability_tag: 'cwe-362: concurrent execution using shared resource with improper synchronization (race condition)'
